question: 端
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. This refers to a literal edge, not a figurative one.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: 

If you're on <vocabulary>edge</vocabulary>, just eat some <reading>hash</reading> (<ja>はし</ja>) browns to feel better! And if you're going to the edge of the world, hash browns will probably help you make it there too. Hash browns are so useful!
